review: I've had problems off and on with this device.  When I've called Roku for customer service, the wait times often are an hour or more.  Tonight I had another problem when the device froze.  I was on hold for about 15 minutes.  When I finally got to the CS rep, he had me unplug the device both from the TV and then the power source.  Next I plugged it in again and it worked.Then he tried to sell me an extended warranty for another $20.  Why should I buy a warranty for a product that should last at least a year I would hope?  I'm angry about this and wonder if Amazon will back this product if it fails again.When it works, I'm very happy with it.  But I don't think I should have to spend another $20 on a warranty when the product is barely two months old!  This seems like a major gyp to me!!
author: Debbie Scott

review: I already own two Roku 3 boxes for home use and I bought this primarily to do presentations in my office TV as it has mirroring abilities from laptops as well as android and windows phones. However, unlike the Roku 3 which works well, the connection for the Roku stick is often not detected, and keeps getting cut off every few minutes, which is unacceptable.
